answers.answer: Hi,How are you?  Generalized sweating or secondary general hyperhidrosis may be attributed to a variety of issues- aside from menopause,  it an also be due to underlying medical conditions such as thyroid problems, diabetes,ifection, rheumatoid arthritis, medication side effect and even malignancy.   With your thyroid issues as well as menopause stage, it is best that you have this checked by your doctor for proper evaluation. Additional diagnostic tests such as your thyroid hormone tests and blood tests may need to be done. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I'm Female, 65, 128 lbs and post menopausal for about 10 years.  For the past many months I've experienced excessive sweating with little or no strenuous activity.  This past summer I experienced a lot of sweating at night, especially if it was warm.  I sweat excessively when I am busy in the kitchen or as earlier today, when I was chilly and put on a light jacket.  Within a minute or two I was sweating.  My hair, clothing and bedding get saturated.   I've told my primary care doctor about it but she hasn't made any suggestions.  Please!  I need some answers.  I have hypo thyroid that is controlled with 50mcg of Levothyroxine daily.  Thank you for any ideas.
title: post menopausal excessive sweating
